thread.title: Food Venture Center gets $7M in funding
thread.title_full: Food Venture Center gets $7M in funding

title: Food Venture Center gets $7M in funding
text:
Williamson businesses and residents are signing up to become part of a solar system. RIT, RGH hold opening ceremonies for RIT's Clinical Health Sciences Center. Thomas Bonadio has grown the Bonadio Group into the nation's 40th largest CPA firm. Steve General Contractor was founded in 1973 by a Jamaican immigrant. Tim Dougherty found satisfaction in creating a nutritional lifestyle. The 2015 edition features an exclusive interview with Paychex CEO Martin Mucci. Food Venture Center gets $7M in funding Rochester Business Journal October 7, 2015 
New York’s wine and beer industries are getting a boost with a $7 million investment announced Wednesday for Cornell University's food-research facility in Ontario County. The New York State Food Venture Center, located in Geneva, will receive the funding, Gov. Andrew Cuomo said during his third annual “Beer, Wine and Spirits Summit.” He also announced an additional $5 million for an advertising campaign to promote the state's craft-beverage industry, and another $5 million for a revolving fund that would offer $50,000 interest-free loans for startup wineries and breweries. Cuomo noted that New York has seen a 436 percent increase in brewery licenses since 2011, his first year in office. He said the money spent on new techniques for wineries and beer labs is a good investment.
